summary:
We need to produce JSON with summary, business_intent, keywords list.

We have file-level metadata: file path is nemo/collections/tts/losses/fastpitchloss.py. It defines loss modules for FastPitch TTS model: DurationLoss, EnergyLoss, MelLoss, PitchLoss. They compute respective losses and define neural type specifications.

We need to summarize the file's responsibility: Provide loss functions for FastPitch TTS model components (duration, energy, mel spectrogram, pitch). Business intent: support training of FastPitch text-to-speech model by providing differentiable loss calculations for various acoustic features. Keywords: FastPitch, TTS, loss, duration, energy, mel spectrogram, pitch, neural types, PyTorch, NeMo.

Make sure not to list function names verbatim? The constraint: Do NOT list function names verbatim. So we shouldn't include "DurationLoss", "EnergyLoss", etc. But we can refer to them generically: loss modules for duration, energy, mel, pitch. Avoid exact class names.

Let's craft summary: The module defines a set of loss components used in training a FastPitch text-to-speech model, each computing the error between predicted and target values for duration, energy, mel-spectrogram, and pitch, and specifying expected neural types for inputs and outputs.

Business intent: Enable accurate and efficient training of FastPitch TTS by providing specialized loss calculations for acoustic and prosodic features.

Keywords list: ["FastPitch", "text-to-speech", "loss functions", "duration prediction", "energy prediction", "mel-spectrogram", "pitch estimation", "NeMo", "PyTorch", "neural type validation"]

Make sure JSON format: {"summary": "...", "business_intent": "...", "keywords": [...]}

Let's produce.assistantfinal{
  "summary": "This module provides a collection of loss components for training a FastPitch text-to-speech model, each computing the discrepancy between predicted and reference values for duration, energy, mel-spectrogram, and pitch, while also defining the expected neural type signatures for the tensors involved.",
  "business_intent": "Facilitate the effective training of FastPitch TTS systems by supplying specialized, differentiable loss calculations for key acoustic and prosodic attributes, ensuring proper type checking and integration within the NeMo framework.",
  "keywords": [
    "FastPitch",
    "text-to-speech",
    "loss functions",
    "duration prediction",
